title: Brooch, "The Weighing Of The Heart", ca. 1998
medium: Gold, faience (amulet fragment, Egyptian, late period?), turquoise, carnelian, ebony, silver
provenance:
2000: purchased by donor from Kennedy Galleries, New York, NY [1]; 2011: acquired by Museum








[1] Purchased at time of the Kennedy Galleries exhibition, "Keven Coates: Jewel Works / Fragments: Pages Stolen From A Book Of Time."
dimensions: H x W x D: 6 x 7.6 x 1.9 cm (2 3/8 in. x 3 in. x 3/4 in.)
description: Roughly rectangular form, the ebony and carnelian surface with applied fragment of Egyptian faience figure in center, flanked by gold heart in scale above gold feet on left, jackle's head hoding scale with feather on right; turquoise beads applied along left and right edges, and center top and bottom edges.

tombstone.epitaph: Brooch, "The Weighing Of The Heart", ca. 1998.Gold, faience (amulet fragment, Egyptian, late period?), turquoise, carnelian, ebony, silver. Gift of Linda Lichtenberg Kaplan. 2011-15-1.
